titleStmt.title: List of Members of a Guild
titleStmt.author: Eutychos the third, son of Eutychos, and the members of his guild

msContents.summary: List of members of a guild, clearly intended as an appendix to an ordinance passed by the guild, the body of which was left to be written in later by a clerk of the grapheion

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
Archive of Kronion son of Apion, nomographos of the grapheion of Tebtynis

handDesc.p: The first hand is a small, well-formed, upright cursive; the second one is written in large crude uncials (slow-writer); the third one is an ill-formed cursive; the fourth one has small, rather careful uncials; and the fifth one is a neat upright cursive

origin.origPlace: Tebtynis, Polemonos meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Pakebkis son of Sigeris (see also P.Mich. V, 244?)
Diodoros alias Papontos son of Kollouthos
Chrates son of Akousilaos (see also P.Mich. V, 280
Heraklas son of Harpaesis (see also P.Mich. II, 123, recto, col. XIV, l. 5
and perhaps P.Mich. II, 128, col. II, l. 7, and V, 240, l. 3: Herakleides son of Harpaesis)
Panesneous (Panesneus) son of Harmiysis (see also P.Mich. V, 244?)
Chrates son of Chairemon alias Onnophris (see also P.Mich. II, 123, recto, col. XIV, l. 36
Sigeris son of Pakebkis (see also P.Mich. V, 244?)

provenance.p: Tebtynis, Polemonos meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Eutychos the third, son of Eutychos, about 50 years old, with a scar on his chin on the left; Pakebkis, son of Sigeris, about 56 years old, with a scar above his right cheek near the temple; Diodoros, among some known also as Papontos, son of Kollouthos, about 38 years old, with a scar on his right calf; and Chrates, son of Akousilaos, about 60 years old, with a scar on both cheeks; and Heraklas, son of Harpaesis, about 29 years old, with a scar on thr 3rd finger of his left hand; Paeus, son of Paeus, about 30 years old, with a scar in the middle of his forehead; and Panesneous, son of Harmiysis, about 32 years old, with a scar on the right eyebrow; Chrates, son of Chairemon also called Onnophris, about 40 years old, with a scar on his forehead to the right; and Sigeris, son of Pakebkis, about 33 years old, with a scar on his forehead to the left.;(2nd hand) I, Diodoros, son of Kollouthos, have voted. (3rd hand) I, Chrates, son of Akousilaos, have voted. (4th hand) I, Heraklas, son of Harpaesis, have voted. (4th hand) I, Chrates, son of Onnophris, have voted.

listBibl.bibl: Boak AER, PMich V, 248, 1944 -- For the date, see P.Mich. V, p. 21.
